Job Title: Mechanical Assembler (LPSD)

Location: Griffin, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Career Area

Operations

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Job Summary

The Mechanical Assembler is responsible for medium to heavy assembly which consists of installing critical engine components in a variety of engine systems or generator set components. The incumbent is also responsible for the assembly of large generator packages, wiring of control panels for the generator packages, and the construction of Canopy containers to house the generator packages.

Responsibilities

 Daily tasks and assignments are provided by normal routine leadership or working with established procedures.  Activities involve moderate system proficiency and data input  Normal routine adjustments with equipment and a normal level of problem identification and resolution are necessary in performing job.  Communicates effectively with inter/intra shift employees. Daily contact may also require a wide range of contacts within and outside the company. 

Basic Qualifications

 At least 6 months of previous manufacturing/mechanical experience  Experience with hand tools or various power tools (which could include wrenches, torques)  Experience with repairing parts 

Top Candidates Will Also Have

 One year of previous assembly or troubleshooting/repairing/operating equipment experience  Cat computer systems such as MES (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently)  The ability to work safely and maintain that focus throughout the day  Excellent communication skills as this position requires daily communication with supporting departments as needed to ensure their work is correct and accurate  Previous automotive experience  Previous maintenance experience  Experience reading and understanding factory orders, blueprints, schematics, work tickets, torque specifications.  Experience with standard work instructions (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently)  Experience with assembly requirements for all parts and assembly procedures (basic skills/knowledge, capable of functioning independently) 

Physical Requirements

 Candidates for all positions must have the ability to work in a fast pace, medium to heavy duty assembly, technical environment.  Work may involve frequent bending, stooping, and kneeling, twisting, turning, climbing, and standing on concrete for 10 hours.  All positions also require the ability to lift up to 25 lbs and withstand frequent repetitive movement of hands with a variety of tooling.  Some positions require the ability to perform tasks on a moving conveyor under time constraints. 

 Compensation & Benefits Offered! 

 40-hour work weeks with potential for Overtime  Multiple shifts offered - Shift premium of 10% per hour for 3rd shift  80 hours of vacation with an additional 40 hours of paid Personal Time Off (PTO)  10 Paid holidays  Climate controlled work environment – most areas  100% 401k match up to 6%  Annual company contribution into your 401k  Health, dental, vision, & life insurance  Quarterly bonus program  Clean/safe work environment  Paid holiday shut down at the end of the year (dependent upon business needs) 

Additional Information

 This position is located in Griffin, GA 

 Please ensure you frequently check the e-mail account you provided on your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method in our recruiting process. 

Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.

This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer such as H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S. which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers

Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. This employer is not currently hiring foreign national applicants that require or will require sponsorship tied to a specific employer, such as, H, L, TN, F, J, E, O. As a global company, Caterpillar offers many job opportunities outside of the U.S which can be found through our employment website at www.caterpillar.com/careers.

Posting Dates

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen.

EEO/AA Employer. All qualified individuals - Including minorities, females, veterans and individuals with disabilities - are encouraged to apply.

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .

Experience Level (if available): None
